meanings.sent1: I will intergraft the two plants to create a new hybrid.
meanings.sent2: The gardener will intergraft the branches to improve fruit production.
meanings.sent3: The trees seemed to intergraft themselves magically overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas and mine intergrafted seamlessly, creating a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes intergrafted colors in a beautiful harmony.

meanings.definition: To join or blend together closely.
meanings.sent1: The flavors of the spices intergrafted perfectly in the dish.
meanings.sent2: The two rivers intergraft at the delta, forming a larger body of water.
meanings.sent3: The friendship between the two children intergrafted quickly and strongly.
meanings.sent4: The different cultures intergrafted, enriching each other's traditions.
meanings.sent5: The music intergrafted various genres, creating a unique sound.
